author: quadratin.slp
title: Galardonan a 4 mujeres con el premio Potosinas del Año 2024 - Noticias de San Luis Potosí
text:
SAN LUIS POTOSÍ, SLP., 29 de febrero de 2024.- Cuatro mujeres que se desempeñan en los ámbitos de la ciencia, salud, desarrollo social y deportivo, obtuvieron el premio Potosina del Año en su edición 2024.
Ellas fueron elegidas mediante un jurado calificador luego de inscribirse en línea y galardonadas por el Gobierno del Estado con una estatuilla y constancia, en el marco del Día Internacional de la Mujer, que se celebra el 8 de marzo.
Lorena Mendoza Rosas
Mendoza Rosas es del municipio de San Luis Potosí y se desempeña en el ámbito deportivo.
Ha destacado por sus logros en la disciplina de karate, principalmente ayudó a diferentes potosinos para que participaran en destacadas competencias como es Daniel Espinoza Niño, además de ser entrenadora nacional de Juegos Centroamericanos en San Salvador y Juegos Panamericanos.
María Alejandra Reyes
Es de la Huasteca Potosina, tiene más de 20 años de experiencia como partera tradicional.
Su historia comenzó cuando se casó y tuvo a su primer hijo, así aprendió para poder ayudar a todas las mujeres que lo necesiten.
Ma. Yolanda López de la Rosa
Yolanda López pertenece a la Zona Altiplano de San Luis Potosí y se ha desempeñado en el ámbito del desarrollo social.
Desde muy pequeña trabajó en el campo, pero al llegar la primera clínica de Seguro Social en la localidad El Zacatón, en el municipio de Villa de Ramos, comenzó a estudiar enfermería y estuvo rodeada de retos que hoy la llevaron a ayudar a muchas mujeres.
Además, logró que Villa de Ramos obtuviera un Centro para el Desarrollo de las Mujeres (CDM).
Martha Imelda Maldonado
Pertenece a la Zona Media de la entidad, es profesora investigadora de tiempo completo, adscrita al programa de Enfermería en la Universidad Autónoma de San Luis Potosí (UASLP) en el campus de Rioverde.
Es química farmacobióloga egresada de la Facultad de Ciencias Químicas, además hizo una maestría y un doctorado en Ciencias Biomédicas Básicas.

author: @infobae
title: Adiós a la incertidumbre, conoce las condiciones climáticas en Rosario - Infobae
text:
La información sobre el clima es cada vez más relevante para la sociedad. (Infobae/Jovani Pérez) Que el estado del tiempo no te tome por sorpresa, esta es la predicción para las próximas horas de este sábado en Rosario, Argentina .
Sin importar si se aprovechará el día para dar un paseo o simplemente ir a la oficina a trabajar, conocer el clima que habrá en las próximas horas puede ayudar a evitar mojarse en la lluvia o cargar innecesariamente un paraguas y abrigo.
Para este sábado, se prevé que en Rosario habrá un 95% de posibilidad de lluvia , así como una temperatura máxima de 22 centígrados y una mínima de 15°. La nubosidad será del 99% y por la noche habrá una posibilidad del 85% de lluvias.
El pronóstico del estado del tiempo en Rosario (Imagen ilustrativa Infobae) El clima en Rosario y sus inviernos cortos
Conocida como la “Cuna de la Bandera Argentina”, esta ciudad portuaria es también la tercera más poblada del país atras de Buenos Aires y Córdoba. Los meses del año más templados para realizar una visita son diciembre, enero y febrero.
A lo largo del año, el clima en la capital ronda entre los 6 °C a 31 °C. Febrero es considerado el mes con más lluvia, mientras que julio es elque registra menos precipitaciones.
Según reportes del Servicio Meteorológico Nacional, 2021 fue uno de los más cálidos en el país.
“Si analizamos con detalle cómo se comportó esta variable en las distintas regiones del país, hay que destacar los valores de Patagonia, región dónde es muy posible que este año sí sea el más caluroso y seco desde 1961. En general, se registraron valores entre 0.5 y 2 °C más elevados que el promedio estadístico. Por otro lado, hacia el norte del paralelo 35, las temperaturas fueron muy cercanas a las normales”, señala el informe “Clima en Argentina: datos y resumen de lo que pasó en el 2021”.
El mismo reporte añade que a lo largo de ese año solo hubo tres meses que cerraron con temperaturas levemente inferiores a las normales en el país: enero, mayo y junio. El resto de los meses fueron cálidos “y es necesario remarcar las anomalías extremadamente cálidas que se registraron en abril y septiembre”.

author: Vlad Schepkov
title: JD.com wins $140M in antimonopoly case against Alibaba By Investing.com
text:
© Reuters. JD +2.74% Add to/Remove from a Portfolio Add to Watchlist Add Position Position added successfully to:
Please name your holdings portfolio Type: BUY SELL Date: Amount: Price Point Value: Leverage: 1:1 1:10 1:25 1:50 1:100 1:200 1:400 1:500 1:1000 Commission: Create New Watchlist Create Create a new holdings portfolio Add Create + Add another position Close BABA +1.48% Add to/Remove from a Portfolio Add to Watchlist Add Position Position added successfully to:
Please name your holdings portfolio Type: BUY SELL Date: Amount: Price Point Value: Leverage: 1:1 1:10 1:25 1:50 1:100 1:200 1:400 1:500 1:1000 Commission: Create New Watchlist Create Create a new holdings portfolio Add Create + Add another position Close JD.com (NASDAQ: JD ) was awarded 1 billion yuan (~$140M) in damages on Friday, after the company won an antimonopoly lawsuit against Alibaba (NYSE: BABA ), according to JD's WeChat statement.
Alibaba, Zhejiang Tmall Network Co and Zhejiang Tmall Technology Co 'had abused their market dominance and adopted monopolistic practices known as "choosing one from two",' The High People's Court of Beijing found, 'causing JD.com severe damage.'
The ruling, called by JD 'a landmark moment in upholding market fairness and competition order through the rule of law,' marks at least a temporary resolution of a lengthy legal battle between the two e-commerce giants over a practice of "choosing one out of two," forcing brands and merchants to sell on one platform exclusively.
An Alibaba spokesperson said the company was aware of the ruling and will respect the court's decision.
The litigation was one of several high-profile cases accusing Alibaba of monopolistic practices - back in 2021, the company was fined $2.75B by the Chinese authorities who found Alibaba had abused its dominant market position.
Shares of JD are gaining modestly following the announcement.
JD.com wins $140M in antimonopoly case against Alibaba

author: Irene Loewenson
title: Marine leaders drop ‘2030’ from name of ambitious overhaul plan
text:
In 2020, Marine Commandant Gen. David Berger unveiled Force Design 2030, his plan for getting his service ready for tough conflicts of the future.
The ambitious initiative has involved
getting rid of tanks, cutting some artillery, and preparing Marines to fight in distributed groups equipped with new technologies.
Force Design 2030 has redefined the Corps’ trajectory in the first years of the decade. It has touched aspects of the service ranging from
ammunition weight to combat medical care to swim training. It has kicked up controversy among some retired Marine leaders, who have lobbied against the changes.
And now, it’s called something slightly different.
“We’re kind of getting away from the ‘2030′ moniker,” Gen. Christopher Mahoney, the assistant commandant, said at a Hudson Institute event in Washington on Thursday.
The Corps’ leaders have started referring to the plan formerly known as Force Design 2030 as simply “Force Design.”
“I just say ‘Force Design’ because I don’t want to say 2031 next year, and 2032,” Commandant Gen. Eric Smith said Oct. 27, 2023, at the
Military Reporters & Editors conference in Washington, two days before he experienced a cardiac arrest that has left him out of office while he recovers.
Smith also prefers to drop the “2030″ from the related initiatives Talent Management 2030 and Training and Education 2030, according to his spokesman, Maj. Joshua Larson.
Smith is still committed to the Force Design concept, Larson said in an emailed statement to Marine Corps Times on Monday.
“He has made it clear that our modernization is a journey, continually refined through a campaign of learning that is informed through Fleet Marine Force experimentation and exercises,” Larson said. “He feels the moniker ‘2030′ makes it sound like there’s an end point, and no longer uses it for the three original pillars of our modernization.”
RELATED
Installations and Logistics 2030, the newest of the service’s modernization plans, is also shedding the “2030,” according to Larson.
“Force Design 2030″ remains in wide use, with the term appearing Monday both in a commentary piece on
War on the Rocks and in a satirical article on Duffel Blog.
The Marine Corps removed the “2030″ from the title of its web page about its modernization initiatives sometime between
Oct. 12 and Oct. 31, according to versions archived by the Wayback Machine. Smith officially became commandant in September, after leading the service in an acting capacity for the two months following Berger’s retirement.
One initiative that will retain the “2030″ designation, according to Smith, is Barracks 2030, the not-yet-released plan for overhauling the living quarters for junior enlisted Marines.
In the near term, the Corps will put civilians in charge of managing barracks, and replace broken locks and outdated furniture, Sergeant Major of the Marine Corps
Carlos Ruiz said in written congressional testimony Wednesday. Longer-term fixes will include renovations focused in part on combating sweltering heat and mold.
“Get it done, 2030,” Smith said in October 2023 of the barracks plan. “That’s to put pressure on me and my team to get that done on behalf of the lance corporals.”
Irene Loewenson is a staff reporter for Marine Corps Times. She joined Military Times as an editorial fellow in August 2022. She is a graduate of Williams College, where she was the editor-in-chief of the student newspaper.

author: A.A.
title: Estos son los 30 municipios valencianos en alerta roja por calor
text: Estos son los 30 municipios valencianos en alerta roja por calor Sanidad rebaja la cifra al pasar de los 53 del jueves a la treintena de hoy A.A. La [Conselleria de Sanidad](https://www.levante-emv.com/tags/conselleria-de-sanidad/) ha rebajado la alerta roja por calor a 30 municipios de la Comunitat Valenciana frente a los más de 50 de este jueves, según ha informado este departamento sanitario. De esta forma, se encuentra en alerta roja, en la comarca de El Comtat, los municipios d'Alcosser y l'Alqueria d'Asnar; en Els Ports, las localidades de Forcall, la Mata de Morella, Palanques, Villores y Zorita del Maestrazgo; en la Hoya de Buñol, Macastre; y en la [Ribera Alta](https://www.levante-emv.com/tags/ribera-alta/), los municipios de Alberic, Antella, Benimuslem, Carcaixent, Gavarda, Massalavés, Alcàntera de Xúquer, Beneixida, Càrcer, Castelló (Villanueva de Castellón), Cotes, l'Ènova, la Pobla Llarga, Manuel, Rafelguaraf, Sant Joanet, Senyera y Sumacàrcer. En La Safor, los municipios de Beniarjó, Beniflá, l'Alqueria de la Comtessa y Rafelcofer, han concretado las mismas fuentes. Municipios en alerta naranja Por otro lado, se ha activado el nivel medio -naranja- por calor en las localidades de Benaguasil, Vilamarxant, Beniarrés, Benilloba, Benimarfull, Gaianes, Muro de Alcoy, Cinctorres, Olocau del Rey, Todolella, Benassal, la Torre d'En Besora, Vilar de Canes, Alborache, Yátova y Dos Aguas. A este listado se suman los municipios de la Torre d'en Doménec, [Alzira](https://www.levante-emv.com/tags/alzira/), Benimodo, Carlet, Catadau, Guadassuar, l'Alcúdia, Tous, Montroi/Montroy, Real, Ador, Alfauir, Almiserà, Almoines, Bellreguard, Castellonet de la Conquesta, el Real de Gandia, la Font d'en Carròs, Llocnou de Sant Jeroni, Miramar, Oliva, Palma de [Gandia](https://www.levante-emv.com/tags/gandia/), Palmera, Piles, Potries, Ròtova, Chulilla, Losa del Obispo y Pedralba. author: Emily Van de Riet
title: Woman says her Stanley cup saved her life from a stray bullet
text: STEUBENVILLE, Ohio (Gray News/TMX) – A woman in Ohio claims her Stanley tumbler saved her from being hit by a stray bullet. A 22-year-old named Rachel posted about the Feb. 12 incident on TikTok, which has since gone viral. Rachel told TMX she and her fiancé David were inside their home in the city of Steubenville when they heard gunshots outside. She said they heard about seven or eight gunshots and then one “really loud bang” from a bullet that came through the wall of the house and ricocheted off her Stanley tumbler, which was sitting directly in front of her. After bouncing off the Stanley cup, the bullet changed direction and went through a bottle of perfume before landing on the kitchen floor, Rachel said. The couple said they hid until police officers arrived. Rachel’s video on TikTok documents the path of the bullet, showing the hole through her wall, the mark on her Stanley cup where the bullet bounced off, and the hole in her perfume bottle. The video also shows the bullet on her kitchen floor. While some TikTok users questioned the authenticity of the claims, Rachel posted a follow-up video showing police in her home, investigating the scene. Gray News has reached out to Steubenville police for comment. However, some fellow Stanley fans were not surprised to hear that their favorite cup was indestructible, even against a bullet. “Who needs body armor? Just grab your Stanley,” one TikTok user wrote. “I’m convinced Stanleys are immortal,” another wrote. Copyright 2024 Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved. TMX contributed to this report.

author: David Griffin
title: John Holcomb: All Smiles For Ollie, Alan After Cowboys' Bowl Win
text: Thursday, December 28th 2023, 3:23 pm It didn’t guarantee the Cowboys would beat a somewhat depleted Texas A&M but it was kind of cool. When I arrived at the hotel on Tuesday I was joined in the elevator by none other than Ollie Gordon II, just us sharing a brief conversation about his Christmas Eve social media video announcing his plans to play in Stillwater again in 2024. Gordon’s trademark smile in that exchange was replaced by his fiery, sometimes excessive reaction to “extra-curricular” tactics by the Aggie defense in the Texas Bowl. The Doak Walker award winner even earned a personal foul penalty for unsportsmanlike conduct at one point. The A&M defense was solely focused on shutting down and frustrating the nation’s leading rusher, but he still managed 118 yards and a touchdown in OSU’s 31-23 win. Afterward Gordon told reporters that the Heisman Trophy needs to return to Stillwater next season. To counter the Aggies’ scheme, the Cowboys utilized other weapons. Alan Bowman found receivers Brennan Presley and Texas Bowl MVP Rashod Owens early and often. The two combined for 26 catches and more than 300 yards with Owens getting into the end zone twice. The win and the award was especially sweet for Owens, who has fought his way up the depth chart playing whatever receiver position was required to become a reliable target in OSU’s emergence this season. Presley’s 16 catches tied a single game school record that dates back to Alex Loyd in 1949, and somewhat fittingly, on one play Presley completed a pass to Owens for a big gain. The Cowboys probably wouldn’t be celebrating an 8th 10-win season under Mike Gundy without quarterback Alan Bowman. His 402 passing yards are an OSU bowl game record, and he could end up with a 7th season of eligibility if the NCAA grants him a waiver. That decision is expected within three weeks. And that brings us to the last trip up the elevator at the hotel, when Bowman and I shared a short ride. His satisfaction on completing a compelling season was evident, with hopes of one more run with the Cowboys in the fall. And just like with Ollie, it was all smiles. December 28th, 2023 December 28th, 2023 December 28th, 2023 December 28th, 2023 December 28th, 2023 December 28th, 2023 December 28th, 2023 December 28th, 2023
